title: 114_hr6161
content: The Act is titled the "Federal Funding Accountability for Sexual Harassers Act". It outlines requirements for institutions of higher education. Section 487(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require institutions to report instances of sex discrimination by principal investigators to federal departments and agencies funding research grants. The amended Section 487(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 mandates institutions to report instances of sex discrimination by principal investigators to federal departments and agencies funding research grants, including details such as the violation date, findings, and required remedies. If a formal complaint alleging sex discrimination is not addressed within 6 months, the institution must report on it within 7 months of filing. The Higher Education Act requires institutions to report sex discrimination complaints to federal agencies funding research grants, including details like complaint status, nature, violation date, and reasons for delays in grievance procedures. Institutions must ensure accuracy and promptly correct any errors in reported information. The Higher Education Act mandates institutions to report sex discrimination complaints to federal agencies funding research grants. Institutions must report corrected information promptly and ensure no personally identifiable information is disclosed. The term 'principal investigator' refers to an individual responsible for the scientific or technical direction of a research and development grant at an institution of higher education. The term 'principal investigator' refers to an individual responsible for the technical direction of a research grant awarded by a Federal department or agency at an institution of higher education. This individual may also be identified as a co-investigator or senior personnel. SEC. 3. REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN FEDERAL DEPARTMENTS AND AGENCIES. Each Federal department or agency awarding research grants must check reports filed under the Higher Education Act for principal investigators at institutions of higher education. Reports must be kept for 10 years. The section outlines the reporting requirements for research grants awarded by Federal departments or agencies to institutions of higher education. Reports must be kept for 10 years, and specific definitions are provided, such as the definition of "institution of higher education." The curr_chunk defines "principal investigator" as per section 487(a)(30)(D) of the Higher Education Act of 1965. SEC. 4. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN FEDERAL DEPARTMENTS AND AGENCIES. Section 1105(a)(40) of title 31, United States Code, is amended to include reporting requirements for Federal departments and agencies awarding research and development grants on a competitive basis. This includes the number of reports received under the Higher Education Act of 1965, disaggregated by different criteria, and the number of cases where grants were recommended for awarding. The principal investigator must have had a report filed against them under the Higher Education Act of 1965 in the previous fiscal year. SEC. 5. STUDY AND REPORT. The Secretary of Education will contract the National Academy of Sciences to conduct a study on sexual harassment in higher education in science, engineering, and medical departments. The study will evaluate the prevalence, impact, and barriers to addressing sexual harassment. A report on the study's results, including the impact on academic careers, must be submitted within 3 years. The National Academy of Sciences will conduct a study on sexual harassment in higher education focusing on science, engineering, and medical departments. The study will assess current institutional procedures, compare them to international programs, and provide evidence-based strategies to reduce sexual harassment.
